Blocks.Name: Prepare oven
Prepare eggs
Prepare batter
Blocks.Content: {"ops":[{"insert":"Using mesh sieve to sift the cake flour, baking powder, and matcha powder over a sheet of parchment paper.\n"}]}

Blocks.Name: Re-sieve mixture
Blocks.Content: {"ops":[{"insert":"Transfer the dry ingredients into the bowl, set the sieve over the parchment paper.\n"}]}

Blocks.Name: Mix the egg yolks
Blocks.Content: {"ops":[{"insert":"In large bowl, mix the egg yolks.\n"}]}

Blocks.Name: Cream egg and sugar
Beat egg white
Blocks.Content: {"ops":[{"insert":"Add the cold egg whites into a large bowl. Beat the egg whites until foamy.\n"}]}

Blocks.Name: Egg white whisking
Blocks.Content: {"ops":[{"insert":"Gradually add remaining sugar and beat until stiff peaks and glossy.\n"}]}

Blocks.Name: Combine egg mixture
Combined mixture
Blocks.Content: {"ops":[{"insert":"Add the dry ingredients. Using the silicone spatula, fold in gently until just incorporated\n"}]}

Blocks.Name: Final touch to batter
Blocks.Content:
{"ops":[{"insert":"Add the warm milk and fold in until incorporated. 

Then Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Spread the batter evenly with silicone pastry scraper.

Tap the jelly roll pan a few times on your working surface to remove air bubble inside the batter.
"}]}

Blocks.Name: Baking process
Blocks.Content: {"ops":[{"insert":"Bake for 12-13 minutes or until top of cake springs back when touched. Make sure not to over bake or the cake will be too dry and break when you roll.\n"}]}

Blocks.Name: Transfer cake from pan
Blocks.Content:
{"ops":[{"insert":"While the pan is still hot, place a sheet of parchment paper and a baking sheet (or a cutting board) on top.

Wearing the oven mitts, flip the baking sheets together (with the cake sandwiched in between). Using a knife or spatula, lift the jelly roll pan to reveal the cake.

Gently remove the parchment paper attached from the cake. 

Place another “protective” sheet of parchment paper and baking sheet on top.

Hold both baking sheets and flip the cake over so that brown side is facing up. Remove the parchment paper.
"}]}

Blocks.Name: Rolling cake
Blocks.Content:
{"ops":[{"insert":"Remove the baking sheet and place the cake on the working surface. Diagonally slice off ¼ inch (1 cm) one side of the cake (shorter end). This will help stabilize the Swiss roll when rolled up.

While the cake is still warm, use your hands to slowly roll the cake on the parchment paper. Once the cake is rolled up, transfer to a wire rack.

Cover with kitchen towel and let it cool completely (until it reaches room temperature, about 30 minutes).


"}]}

Blocks.Name: Prepare matcha cream
Assembling cake
Blocks.Content:
{"ops":[{"insert":"Transfer the swiss roll to a flat surface and unroll the cake.

Using an offset spatula, spread the matcha cream mixture evenly over the cake, leaving a ½-inch border on all sides.

Carefully but tightly re-roll the cake. The seam side should be on the bottom.
"}]}

Blocks.Name: Finishing touch
Blocks.Content:
{"ops":[{"insert":"Refrigerate for at least 2 hours to firm up the cream.

Remove and unwrap the Swiss roll. Slice off about ½ inch of the cake on both ends.

If you have leftovers, just re-wrap the swiss roll in a plastic wrap and store in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
"}]}
